It is exceptionally helpful to me that you have already prepared animations and examples to demonstrate intuitively what is going on in this series of videos, Grant! Thank you so much! It really matches the way that I learn.

Nice challenge problem: Find the 'fixed points' of the transformation. This means find two points such that the arrow points straight down (where the arrow length is minimal). Equivalently, find the pre-image points which are identical to their image points , i.e. find x such that the transformation leaves the point unchanged .

Algebraically solve f(x) = x

substituting we get x^2 -x = 3
solving we get approximately
 x= 2.302775638, -1.302775638
